title: JAM / HORSEBACK MONUMENT
description: On the traffic island in the jam, an old monument of Filippe III The Squanderer pointing towards an unknown location in the sea. The chest region seems to have suffered chip damage.

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "The scaffolding around the old monu..."
dialogueTree.text: The scaffolding around the old monument has been taken down. In its place are the spoils of your investment. Numerous rods and ropes still hold the original reassemblage in place.

links.title: You: "Reflect on the re-conceptualization..."
links.text: Reflect on the re-conceptualization.

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The roundabout is quiet, almost eer..."
links.text: The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The doom crier in the centre waits to be swallowed by the bright sky, his cardboard omen flapping in the wind like live bait...

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The roundabout is quiet, almost eer..."
links.text: The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sun. The king of disco is lit up like a stage, anticipating a funky beat that will never come...

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The roundabout is quiet, almost eer..."
links.text: The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The penumbral griever is a silhouette against the bright sky, the flowers lifting him in requiem starting to wilt...

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The roundabout is quiet, almost eer..."
links.text: The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The tickets remain true to their duty -- except for a few that have come unstuck, now assigned to brushing dirt from the asphalt below...

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The roundabout is quiet, almost eer..."
links.text: The roundabout is quiet, almost eerily so under the brilliant sunlight. The formless complexion glows at the centre, while the old architecture surrounding it groans in the heat with looming irrelevance...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The more you ask yourself, the less..."
links.text: The more you ask yourself, the less you know. One thing is for certain, though: you're brain-damaged. It's serious. And permanent.

links.title: You: "Examine the scaffolding."
links.text: Examine the scaffolding.

links.title: Horseback Monument: "A matrix of metal tubes and wooden..."
links.text: A matrix of metal tubes and wooden planks jut out at odd angles. A miserable tarpaulin covers up the horse and rider, flapping in the cold coastal air...

links.title: Horseback Monument: "There are no lights that spell out..."
links.text: There are no lights that spell out your name, no workers with calloused hands leering from above -- just construction materials displayed as if to mourn your misplaced dreams.

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The old king looks defiantly to the..."
links.text: The old king looks defiantly to the west, wrapped in makeshift scaffolding like a mummy...

links.title: Conceptualization: "There's not an *ounce* of artistry..."
links.text: There's not an *ounce* of artistry here! It's even worse than expected.

links.title: Half Light: "That son of a bitch scammed you! Pr..."
links.text: That son of a bitch scammed you! Probably to *make fun of you*...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "This is *not* what that Personal Br..."
links.text: This is *not* what that Personal Brand Strategist of yours promised. No one even knows that you're paying for this re-conceptualization! Go and have a word with him. Find out what's going on.

links.title: You: "Who is this?"
links.text: Who is this?

links.title: Horseback Monument: "A silver plaque on the statue's ped..."
links.text: A silver plaque on the statue's pedestal reads: 'I am Filippe III, the Squanderer, the Greatest of the Filippian Kings of Revachol; Son of Filippe II, the Opulent; Father of Filippe IV, the Insane.'

links.title: Volition: "Not a good track record of mental h..."
links.text: Not a good track record of mental health in that family.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "As you look up, you notice somethin..."
links.text: As you look up, you notice something about the statue. There are some odd indentations on the king's chest piece...

links.title: You: "What indentations? What do I see?"
links.text: What indentations? What do I see?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Something with great kinetic energy..."
links.text: Something with great kinetic energy seems to have impacted the cuirass... around where the 'heart' is. A bullet?

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Someone's shot him in the heart. In..."
links.text: Someone's shot him in the heart. Interesting.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant -- has someone *shot* t..."
links.text: "Lieutenant -- has someone *shot* the king?" (Point to the indentation)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay..." He cleans his glasses bef..."
links.text: "Okay..." He cleans his glasses before looking up. "I can't see it. But I'll take your word for it."

links.title: You: ""What do you think?""
links.text: "What do you think?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well... Martinaise is riddled with..."
links.text: "Well... Martinaise is riddled with bullet holes. This place saw a lot of action during the Revolution. But the statue *is* recently renovated -- so maybe a joke? Target practice? Or a political statement?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, a practical joke.""
links.text: "Yes, a practical joke."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why not?" He shrugs. "What this sh..."
links.text: "Why not?" He shrugs. "What this shows us is guns aren't too uncommon here. And people still shoot them. Sometimes at kings." He takes a note in his notebook.

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The king stands high above you, sur..."
links.text: The king stands high above you, surveying the bay. Mute and indifferent to your sightings.

links.title: You: ""Mhm, target practice.""
links.text: "Mhm, target practice."

links.title: You: ""Political. It's a *king* and he's..."
links.text: "Political. It's a *king* and he's shot."

links.title: You: ""None of the above. Maybe it's conn..."
links.text: "None of the above. Maybe it's connected to the murder?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If we connect every bullet hole in..."
links.text: "If we connect every bullet hole in Martinaise to the murder, we'll get an overwhelming amount of loose threads..." He takes his notebook out. "But then again, our guy *was* shot. And that hole would be recent."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He takes a note. "It's not *complet..."
links.text: He takes a note. "It's not *completely* tangential -- at least worth noting down. I wouldn't hold my breath, though."

links.title: Inland Empire: "We'll see."
links.text: We'll see.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If we connect every bullet hole in..."
links.text: "If we connect every bullet hole in Martinaise to the murder, we'll get an overwhelming amount of loose threads..." He takes his notebook out. "But then again, we don't really know what we're dealing with here, so..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He takes a note. "I've made a note...."
links.text: He takes a note. "I've made a note. Don't hold your breath."

links.title: You: "Don't mention it."
links.text: Don't mention it.

links.title: Horseback Monument: "The monument stands high above you...."
links.text: The monument stands high above you. Mute and indifferent to your sightings.

links.title: You: "What did this king do?"
links.text: What did this king do?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Even by the standards of the Filipp..."
links.text: Even by the standards of the Filippian kings, Old Sumptuous Filippe was known for his profligacy.

links.title: You: "In what way?"
links.text: In what way?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Well, he blew through the whole nat..."
links.text: Well, he blew through the whole national treasury, starting the decline of one of the penultimate century's greatest superpowers: the Suzerain of Revachol...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "His own maladministration foreshado..."
links.text: His own maladministration foreshadowed the fall of the monarchy during the Antecentennial Revolution, an end to his family line and the monarchy on the Insulindian isola.

links.title: You: "How did he manage to blow through *..."
links.text: How did he manage to blow through *the entire national treasury*?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Stories have it that he had his bed..."
links.text: Stories have it that he had his bedroom converted into a treasure chamber where he stored unfathomable wealth: *krugerrands*, bars of gold, ornate weaponry, armour, and various chalices.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "He called it the *Sol Aurum*. It wa..."
links.text: He called it the *Sol Aurum*. It was obscene. There were whispers he slept on a huge pile of gold-dipped feathers like some obese dragon, instead of a bed like a normal person.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "The man certainly knew how to live!"
links.text: The man certainly knew how to live!

links.title: You: "I would like to sleep on gold. Hust..."
links.text: I would like to sleep on gold. Hustler-style.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "But wait! You haven't even heard ab..."
links.text: But wait! You haven't even heard about his fabled cocaine addiction.

links.title: You: "The what now?"
links.text: The what now?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You see, Old Filippe wasn't just go..."
links.text: You see, Old Filippe wasn't just good at squandering the national treasury on gold and ceremonial weaponry. He was also a prodigious snorter of nose candy.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Not just *any* nose candy, though...."
links.text: Not just *any* nose candy, though. We're talking royal *Filippian* blow, allegedly twice as potent as the stuff you find nowadays. And purple, Filippian cocaine was purple.

links.title: You: "Okay, what is nose candy?"
links.text: Okay, what is nose candy?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Cocaine."
links.text: Cocaine.

links.title: You: "This is... a lot to process."
links.text: This is... a lot to process.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "His Majesty's courtiers said it hel..."
links.text: His Majesty's courtiers said it helped him connect with the *Higher Realms*.

links.title: You: "So he was addicted to nose candy. A..."
links.text: So he was addicted to nose candy. A bloated druggie?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "That's what the revolutionaries sai..."
links.text: That's what the revolutionaries said -- 150 years later. Right before they emptied out the royal mausoleum and dumped His Majesty's mortal remains in the Insulindian Bay.

links.title: Authority: "This is slander. The king was just..."
links.text: This is slander. The king was just and beautiful. The revolutionaries made this all up.

links.title: You: "Okay. Where is he buried now? (Proc..."
links.text: Okay. Where is he buried now? (Proceed.)

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Beneath the cold waters of the Insu..."
links.text: Beneath the cold waters of the Insulindian Bay, thrown there by the revolutionaries after they cleaned out the royal mausoleum.

links.title: Shivers: "A group of marble pleurants still s..."
links.text: A group of marble pleurants still surrounds the king's vandalized tomb... A deathly cold wind sweeps up candy wrappers and old newspapers.

links.title: You: "What happened to the statue?"
links.text: What happened to the statue?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The original was blown apart by com..."
links.text: The original was blown apart by communards, then further damaged during the landing of the Coalition's airships during the Turn-Of-The-Century Revolution. When Martinaise was levelled.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Most historians think the Coalition..."
links.text: Most historians think the Coalition's hasty landing may have ultimately *saved* the statue: If the communards had more time they would have reduced it up to even *finer* pieces.

links.title: You: "Who restored the monument?"
links.text: Who restored the monument?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Some years ago a group of liberal,..."
links.text: Some years ago a group of liberal, artistically inclined individuals (designers mostly) thought it would be *ironic* to restore the statue of the most wasteful ruler of Revachol in the poorest part of the city...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The statue is supposed to capture t..."
links.text: The statue is supposed to capture the moment it was blown apart, like *an instant frozen in time*. A rare butterfly, trapped in amber, floating on a sea of... shit.

links.title: You: "That's brilliant! So funny and nihi..."
links.text: That's brilliant! So funny and nihilistic.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "People in Martinaise tend to disagr..."
links.text: People in Martinaise tend to disagree, as do many prominent art critics and thought leaders with more *nuanced* social awareness than the young ironists.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Those critics might have it wrong,..."
links.text: Those critics might have it wrong, though. There's more to it than just 'ironism'... but you can't say what precisely. Perhaps this art mystery will be solved at a later time?

links.title: Horseback Monument: "Filippe III, the Squanderer, howeve..."
links.text: Filippe III, the Squanderer, however, with his bronze face up in the air, doesn't seem concerned about what the *hoi polloi* think of him in death.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Not that he ever did in life, eithe..."
links.text: Not that he ever did in life, either.

links.title: You: "That's such a bad idea."
links.text: That's such a bad idea.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "People in Martinaise tend to agree,..."
links.text: People in Martinaise tend to agree, as do many prominent art critics and thought leaders with more *nuanced* social awareness than the young ironists.

links.title: You: "I *really* don't get art."
links.text: I *really* don't get art.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Neither do people in Martinaise. Th..."
links.text: Neither do people in Martinaise. The statue has proved to be *controversial* in a neighbourhood mostly populated by the left-leaning working class.

links.title: You: "I don't want to know."
links.text: I don't want to know.

links.title: You: "The king is the king and he can do..."
links.text: The king is the king and he can do *anything*.

links.title: You: "Wait, really? There's no way that's..."
links.text: Wait, really? There's no way that's true.

links.title: You: "A deplorable farce. No wonder every..."
links.text: A deplorable farce. No wonder everything went to shit.

links.title: You: "Fair enough, I have other questions..."
links.text: Fair enough, I have other questions. (Stop the knowledge from pouring in.)

links.title: Horseback Monument: "Filippe III's ludicrous bronze like..."
links.text: Filippe III's ludicrous bronze likeness looks defiantly up into the sky.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "What did he do? You have no idea wh..."
links.text: What did he do? You have no idea what *you* did a week ago! How would you know what this guy did many centuries ago?

links.title: Horseback Monument: "High above you, the king stands tri..."
links.text: High above you, the king stands triumphantly oblivious to your memory trouble.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "An old monument stands in the middl..."
dialogueTree.text: An old monument stands in the middle of the traffic island. It is surrounded by scaffolding that has been haphazardly erected around it.

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "An old monument stands in the middl..."
dialogueTree.text: An old monument stands in the middle of the traffic island, pointing toward the sea. It's been covered in posters with radical slogans like 'NO KINGS, NO BOSSES' and 'AGAIN, AND ONCE MORE AFTER THAT!'

links.title: Horseback Monument: "At the bottom of the posters, in sm..."
links.text: At the bottom of the posters, in smaller lettering, are details about meeting at a local coffeehouse.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like the students took your..."
links.text: "Looks like the students took your advice to heart, detective."

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "An old monument stands in the middl..."
dialogueTree.text: An old monument stands in the middle of the traffic island, pointing toward the sea. The horse and rider appear to be struggling against the vibrantly coloured cables and coiled wire.

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "An old monument stands in the middl..."
dialogueTree.text: An old monument stands in the middle of the traffic island, pointing toward the sea. The whole thing is wrapped in vibrantly coloured cables and coiled wire. Where the horse's head should be, only twisted pieces of rebar remain.

dialogueTree.title: Horseback Monument: "An old monument stands in the middl..."
dialogueTree.text: An old monument stands in the middle of the traffic island, pointing toward the sea. It looks as if it's been reassembled piece-by-piece, secured and mounted in the air with the aid of numerous ropes and rods.
